info.title: Inventory Management
info.description: Maintaining up-to-date inventory for items on Walmart.com ensures a great customer experience as well as greater sales opportunities. The Inventory Management APIs allow management of current or recently changed inventory supply.

get.description: This request retrieves the inventory count for a single item for one specific ship node.

0.name: sku
0.description:
Specifies the stock keeping unit (SKU) item identifier. 

This type of identifier is an arbitrary, alphanumeric identifier that is specified by the drop ship vendor (DSV) and used by the vendor in the specification file to refer to each item. 

Either the 'sku' or 'gtin' parameter will be required. The user can only submit one. 

The following special characters in the stock keeping unit (SKU) require encoding: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', ‘ ’, '{', and '}'. '%' requires encoding if it is part of the stock keeping unit (SKU). Encode spaces with %20. Other characters do not require encoding.

1.name: gtin
1.description:
Specifies the global trade item number (GTIN) item identifier. 

The global trade item number is a 14-digit number, including the check digit, that is used worldwide and identifies the Each. If the user's number is less than 14 digits, add zeros at the beginning. 

Either the `sku` or `gtin` parameter will be required. The user can only submit one.

2.name: shipNode
2.description:
Specifies the distribution facility distributor identifier. 

 This parameter identifies each facility from which the inventory is requested. The identifier is autogenerated during drop ship vendor (DSV) account creation. Every time users add or update a facility in Supplier Center, a new identifier is generated.

7.name: WM_SEC.AUTH_SIGNATURE
7.description: The vendor's digital signature, generated by running the JAR file or custom generation code

8.name: WM_CONSUMER.ID
8.description: A unique ID required to access the API
8.example: Get the Consumer ID from Developer Center after logging in

sku.description:
Indicates the stock keeping unit (SKU) item identifier. 

This is a product identifier provided by the drop ship vendor (DSV) to identify each item.

gtin.description: Indicates the global trade item number (GTIN) item identifier.

unit.description: Indicates the quantity unit of measurement.

amount.description: Indicates the quantity of the product available in inventory.

quantity.description: Indicates an object for information about the quantity in inventory.

sku.description:

gtin.description: Indicates the global trade item number (GTIN) item identifier.

amount.description: Indicates the quantity of the product available in inventory.

quantity.description: Indicates an object for information about the quantity in inventory.

put.description:
This request updates the inventory for an item, with the item global trade item number (GTIN) as the primary item identifier. Use an availability code to identify how inventory quantity is managed for an item.

The following are valid availability codes:

AC: Use for standard or normal inventory updates.

AA: Use for an item with infinite or unlimited inventory. Quantity is not required when set to AA.

The drop ship vendor (DSV) supplier sends the `onHand` quantity in the amount field as one whole quantity (unit and value).

0.name: shipNode
0.description:
Specifies the distribution facility distributor identifier. 

 This parameter identifies each facility from which the inventory is requested. The identifier is autogenerated during drop ship vendor (DSV) account creation. Every time users add or update a facility in Supplier Center, a new identifier is generated.

5.name: WM_SEC.AUTH_SIGNATURE
5.description: The vendor's digital signature, generated by running the JAR file or custom generation code

6.name: WM_CONSUMER.ID
6.description: A unique ID required to access the API
6.example: Get the Consumer ID from Developer Center after logging in

gtin.description:
Specifies the global trade item number (GTIN) item identifier. 

The global trade item number is a 14-digit number, including the check digit, that is used worldwide and identifies the Each. If the user’s number is less than 14 digits, add zeros at the beginning.

availabilityCode.description:
Specifies how to manage the inventory update. 

AC: The code used for standard inventory updates. Assign this code to an item with normal inventory. 

AA: An item with infinite inventory. If users set AA as the availability code, they do not need to provide inventory for the item.

unit.description: Indicates the unit of measurement the quantity of an item.

amount.description: Indicates the value for the quantity of an item.

quantity.description: Indicates an object for the quantity that has been ordered by the customers, but not yet shipped.

post.description: This request updates inventory for items in bulk. The seller can either use feed type 'DSV_INVENTORY' or 'inventory'. DSV_INVENTORY: This feed type updates inventory across multiple ship nodes across multiple products. There are two versions: v2.x and v1.5. * For v2.x, these updates are global trade item number (GTIN) based and have a flat data structure for enhanced processing. * For v1.5, these updates are stock keeping unit (SKU) based and have a complex data structure. The multi-node inventory update feed (feedType=DSV_INVENTORY) supports JSON requests and responses only. inventory: This feed type supports updating inventory across multiple ship nodes across multiple products. There is one version: v1.4. * v1.4 supports updating inventory at multiple ship nodes across multiple products. For more information about feed types, see the guide section. Rate limits apply to file feeds. Rate limits are 20 calls per hour. The maximum limit of 10,000 items per hour per `shipNode` combinations. The file size limit is 1MB.

1.name: shipNode
1.description:
Specifies the distribution facility distributor identifier. 

 This parameter identifies each facility from which the inventory is requested. 

The parameter is required for `Inventory` feed type. It is not required for `DSV_INVENTORY` feed type. 

The identifier is autogenerated during drop ship vendor (DSV) account creation. Every time users add or update a facility in Supplier Center, a new identifier is generated.

7.description: A unique ID required to access the API
7.example: Get the Consumer ID from Developer Center after logging in

version.description: Specifies the inventory feed header version.

feedType.description:
Specifies the feed type for inventory feed header information. 

Feed types include: 
`DSV_INVENTORY`

feedDate.description: Specifies the inventory feed header feed date.

locale.description: Specifies the inventory feed header locale.

businessUnit.description: Specifies the inventory feed header business unit.

inventoryFeedHeader.description: Specifies an object for inventory feed header information.

inventory.description: Specifies an object for inventory information.

productId.description:
Specifies the product identifier for the item. 

 This parameter can only be a global trade item number (GTIN). 

The global trade item number (GTIN) is a 14-digit number, including the check digit, that is used worldwide and identifies the Each. If the user’s number is less than 14 digits, add zeros at the beginning.

shipNode.description: Specifies the distributor identifier for the distribution facility, used to identify each facility.

availabilityCode.description:
Specifies the code that identifies how to manage the inventory update. 

Codes include: 

AC: The code used for standard inventory updates. Assign this code to an item with normal inventory. 

AA: An item with infinite inventory. If users set AA as the `availabilityCode`, they do not need to provide inventory for the item.

quantity.description: Specifies the item quantity available in the inventory.

items.description: Specifies an object for inventory information.

feedId.description: Indicates an identifier, returned from the Bulk Upload API, used for tracking the feed file."

get.summary: Single Item Inventory Across Ship Nodes
get.description: This request retrieves the inventory count for an item across multiple ship nodes or for one specific ship node. Users can specify the ship node(s) for which they want to fetch the inventory.

0.name: id
0.description:
Specifies the value of the stock keeping unit (SKU) or global trade item number (GTIN) item identifier. 

This value is provided by the drop ship vendor (DSV) to identify each item.

1.name: shipNode
1.description:
Specifies the distribution facility distributor identifier. 

 This parameter identifies each facility from which the inventory is requested. The identifier is autogenerated during drop ship vendor (DSV) account creation. Every time users add or update a facility in Supplier Center, a new identifier is generated.

2.name: productIdType
2.description:
Specifies the type of item ID the user is searching. 

Default: sku

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

accessToken.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
accessToken.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

channelType.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
channelType.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

correlationId.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
correlationId.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID
